name: Tadga Raho x Desi Breakfast Club
description:
We’re bringing fitness and flavour together in one power-packed morning!
Join us for a special collaboration between Tagda Raho and Treat’s Desi Breakfast Club.

📅 Date
Sunday, 21st September 2025

⏰ Time 
Workout @ Tagda Raho Dugout, Ulsoor: 
08:00 AM – 09:30 AM
Breakfast @ Treat, Indiranagar: 
10:00 AM onwards

👥 Spots: Limited to 25 participants

Kickstart your Sunday with strength, community, and movement at the dugout, followed by a hearty desi breakfast spread — Chole Bhature, Parathas, Keema Pav, and more.

💥 Tagda raho, aur desi naashta khao!

name: Pint of View (Lecture 4): Much Ado About Drawing
description:
Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.

In our fourth lecture, we’re bringing you Kaustubh Khare, a semiotician, educator, and believer that everyone can draw. This one’s special: part lecture, part workshop on visual thinking. Kaustubh will show how doodling and drawing can transform into tools for clarity, creativity, and sharper articulation, and even help ideas stick in memory for longer. All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar.

What to Expect:

• A 60-minute lecture-workshop on visual thinking and its everyday applications
• 15–20 minutes of interactive Q&A
• One Geist beer on tap included with your ticket
• A lively mixer to share what you drew, see how others mapped their insights, and take home a new perspective

This isn’t an art class or a drawing workshop. Through Kaustubh’s lived experience, we’ll explore the science of visual thinking and its real-world uses: from mind maps and graphs to teaching tools and even investor pitch decks. All in the chill vibe of a pub lecture, over a drink and some grub.

Event Details:

📅 Sunday, 21st September | 4 PM – 6 PM
📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar
🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only

About the Lecturer

Kaustubh Khare believes that everyone can draw and that drawing is less about talent and more about how we think. His lecture-workshops transform doodling into a powerful tool for clarity, creativity, and collaboration. He has worked with governments, universities, startups, and nonprofits on diverse projects, including designing visual pedagogical tools now used by over half a million government school teachers in Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh. A graduate of IIT Kharagpur, Ashoka University, and the University of Tartu, he is currently exploring how India's heritage can be brought alive through visual storytelling.

About Pint of View

Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.

Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Frisbee With The Sisters
description:
FRISBEE WITH THE SISTERS!

Never thrown a disc before? No stress — this one’s for beginners and frisbee-curious folks alike! We’ll kick off with a warm-up and the basics: how to hold, throw, and catch like a pro (yes, both backhand and forehand).

You’ll then split into smaller groups with coaches helping you perfect your throws and build confidence with simple, fun drills. Once you’re feeling good with the disc, it's game time!

After a quick rules rundown (no contact, how to score, what a turnover is), we’ll dive into a friendly match full of running, teamwork, and big laughs.

We wrap it up with a cool down and group photo — but you’ll leave with new skills, sore cheeks from smiling, and maybe a new favourite sport.

All levels welcome — just bring your energy!

name: Pulse (2001) with The Parallel Cinema Club
description:
Our meetings consist of a screening of an arthouse film, followed by a discussion. The discussion is led by one of our members or sometimes a guest speaker and encourages members to share their thoughts and interpretations of the film.

Who are The Parallel Cinema Club?
A community-run film society, we are a collective of film enthusiasts who gather weekly to explore the world of cinema, discuss auteurs and themes, and occasionally host guest lectures.

name: Becoming Male in The Middle Ages (2022) and Lan Yu (2001) with The Parallel Cinema Club
description:
Our meetings consist of a screening of an arthouse film, followed by a discussion. The discussion is led by one of our members or sometimes a guest speaker and encourages members to share their thoughts and interpretations of the film.

Who are The Parallel Cinema Club?
A community-run film society, we are a collective of film enthusiasts who gather weekly to explore the world of cinema, discuss auteurs and themes, and occasionally host guest lectures.

name: IndieWebClub #10 with Ankur and Tanvi
description:
What is IndieWebClub?

IndieWebClub is part of a growing world-wide network of meetups for everyone who wants to take back their web experience from social media silos, and own their online identities & content, or just want support with blogging!

Want to blog more and looking for: ideas, momentum, and a supportive community?
Join a gathering of like-minded people and get friendly support with writing, creating, and anything related to using and improving your own website!
    You do not need to have any tech background or experience in having your own website. You can even start with a Google Doc or your local notes app!

Agenda

This will be a tech and design focused session during which we’ll co-work on our personal websites.

Please join us even if you don’t have any programming experience! We’ll help you with any technical questions you might have. If possible, we’ll pair you up with a buddy who can walk you through setting up a website or making changes to an existing one.

Bring:

    Your laptop (+ charger)
    Ideas about what services/features/designs you want your website to have
    If you’re non-technical, come with questions and we’ll try to find you answers

As usual, we will end the meetup with a prompt and a writing session.

name: Death Literacy in India
description:
There's life that's lived by millions in this country who lie at the tail end of their mortality, despite the endless emphasis around our demographic dividend peak (i.e., the youth of this country).

This month at Select, we have Aparna, psychologist and one of India's very few End of Life care researchers, who will be taking us through the bumpy landscape of Indian elderly care. Join us to learn about the numerous measures that exist in this country which many of us seldom pay heed to until it's too late, alongside understanding what it takes to bridge the dissonance between need and have for the lovely people we know living in their golden years. 

So come on over and make sure that you’re good to go!

As always, all are welcome!

name: Belly Dance Workshop
description:
Hey sisters, get ready to shake, shimmy, and slay!
Join us for a Beginner-Friendly Belly Dancing Workshop that’s all about movement, magic, and major good vibes. No experience needed — just bring your energy and let’s groove together!

Date: 27th September 2025

Time: 11:30 AM – 1:00 PM

Location: Dhurii Academy of Arts, Domlur

Let’s awaken, heal, and balance — through the power of dance!

name: Indiranagar Code Walk!
description:
Join us for a warm and playful exploration of Indiranagar that weaves together stories of the neighborhood, its history, and its people with hands-on creative coding using p5.js. Along the way, you’ll uncover hidden corners, listen to local anecdotes, and turn your impressions into small pieces of code-art that connect the city’s past and present.

Please bring a phone and a laptop — we’ll be coding as we walk and pause. There will be some light walking involved, so wear comfortable clothes and shoes. You get to take photos, recordings, notes while you walk and then we embed that into code once we are back to the lab. The walk starts from Paper Crane Lab. 

General Rules:
-Ages 18 and above.
-Contact 9845620061 for more details
-Please bring your own Laptops (Mac/Windows/Linux is okay)

name: The Soma Flow Fest
description:
Join us on Saturday, September 20th, from 4:45 PM – 6:30 PM, at the charming Bungalow 157 in Domlur, Bangalore for a grounding evening of movement and mindful connection.

Hosted by Lunasole, in collaboration with Nuvedo, this unique session blends the calming benefits of functional mushrooms with a restorative somatic flow, giving you space to slow down, release tension, and reconnect with yourself.


Event Flow :

Reishi Mushroom Tea Ceremony (30 mins)

We’ll begin with a mindful tea ritual featuring Nuvedo’s premium Reishi Extract. Known for its calming adaptogenic properties, this infusion helps the nervous system unwind and sets the tone for a deeply restorative practice.

Somatic Movement (60 mins)

Guided through a gentle somatic flow, you’ll explore breath-led, intuitive movement designed to ease stored tension, improve body awareness, and bring balance back to your system. This is a slow, nourishing practice, open to all levels.

About the Space – Bungalow 157

We’ll gather in the lush outdoor lawn of Bungalow 157, a restored heritage bungalow in Domlur. With its warm aesthetic and thoughtfully designed ambience, the space feels like a little sanctuary in the city, the perfect setting to ground, move, and connect.

name: Beyond Tea: A 5-Course High Tea Supper with Sakaré & Foodstories
description:
Step into an elevated high tea experience - a 5 course supper where every plate tells a story and every sip has a perfect match.

We begin with a savoury course and a refreshing pour, then move into courses specially curated by our friends at Sakaré, each one designed to surprise with textures, flavours and thoughtful pairings from the  Juicery at our Garden Cafe

name: Book Launch: Real Life by Amrita Mahale
description:
Join us for the launch of Real Life, a haunting new novel set in the remote Mahamaya Valley of the Himalayas. When wildlife biologist Tara disappears without a trace, her friend Mansi embarks on a desperate search to uncover the truth. As suspicion falls on Bhaskar—Tara’s obsessive acquaintance whose story is riddled with contradictions—the valley itself begins to emerge as a character: a place where technology and nature clash, and where a woman’s voice can be silenced in countless ways.

Through luminous prose, Real Life unfolds as both a gripping mystery and a profound meditation on love, loss, surveillance, and the struggle for authenticity in a world that demands conformity.

Be part of an evening of conversation, readings, and reflection as we celebrate this powerful exploration of what it means to live—and to be seen—on one’s own terms.

name: The Ex-Daughters of Tolstoy House
description:
Join us for an engaging evening as Arunima Tenzin Tara and Sheila Kumar delve into the intricate layers of The Ex-Daughters of Tolstoy House. The discussion will explore the novel's exploration of patriarchy and its impact on what appears to be a perfect Indian family. Through their conversation, they will shed light on the larger implications of misogyny in Indian society and how literature can serve as a mirror to these societal issues.

This event promises to be an insightful exploration of themes that resonate deeply in contemporary society. Whether you're a fan of gothic-noir fiction or interested in discussions about societal structures and their representations in literature, this evening offers a platform for thoughtful dialogue and reflection.

name: Hydroponics 101
description:
Join us for Hydroponics 101, a hands-on urban farming workshop in Bangalore designed for beginners and city dwellers curious about growing their own food. Learn how to grow clean, fresh, pesticide-free vegetables right on your balcony or terrace, no soil needed! This guided session will walk you through hydroponic systems, plant care, nutrient mixing, low-cost hacks for compact urban setups, and more!

As part of the experience, you’ll also get to taste freshly harvested hydroponic produce and understand the difference clean food makes. All materials will be provided, and participants will receive personalised guidance from our experienced host. 

Bonus: All attendees go home with a free self-watering plant! 🌱

Limited seats for a more personalized experience. Perfect for beginners, no prior experience needed!

DM us at @urbangronchain for any doubts :)

name: Paired Up - Chef Kalyan X SDU Winery
description:
A wine dinner built for meat lovers only. Think bold naati flavours reimagined through a five-course menu, each savoury dish paired to perfection with SDU wines. Chef Kalyan’s taking the lead on the food, and together it’s going to be a pairing you won’t forget.

Course 1
Kothmiri meenu
Coriander-Lemon Grilled seabass, potato chips, Old Bangalore style
SDU Reserva Chardonnay
Course 2
Miriyalu Pitta
Peppered up quail, mini idlis
SDU Reserva Syrah
Course 3
Kaalchina Pandi Maamsam
Grilled pork skewers, akki rottil
SDU Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon
Course 4
Bannur Kuri Chops
Bannur Lamb Chops, Khaima pongal
SDU Wine Maker's Selection
Course 5
Pheni
Pheni, milk, served the Old Bangalore way

name: I AM THE FUTURE
description:
Special Screening of "I Am the Future" by Rachel Cisinski.

About the movie: 
I Am The Future is an original film project.
It is a docu-fiction, conceived, written, and directed BY young people, ABOUT young people, FOR young people.
A project that portrays a youth full of hope, dreams, and ambition, far from the clichés often conveyed by the media.
Behind the camera, Rachel Cisinski relies on the precision and strength of her shots to spark emotion and reveal the full intensity of the journeys of these four young people.
Whether you are passionate about directing, documentary storytelling, or fiction, this film is an opportunity to discover a cinematic language where commitment and creativity meet.
Come see the future… through the eyes of those who are building it.

name: Panel: Future of Small Publishing | Indie Ink 2025
description:
“The Future of Small & Independent Publishing” – a conversation on the evolving landscape of indie publishing, the role of community, and the possibilities that lie ahead.

Panelists:
Nikhil Ravichandar, LURU Magazine
Mohit Mahato, Pagal Canvas

When: September 27, Saturday, 12 PM
Where: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar

Free entry! Registration must.

name: Workshop: Zine-making + Reading
description:
Zine Workshop + Reading with Nikhil Poddar 

Join us for an evening of storytelling, zine-making, and conversation with Nikhil Poddar as he conducts a Storytelling for Zines Workshop and does a live reading of his zine Akela.

Learn how to turn ideas into zines, experiment with narrative formats, and hear Akela come alive. Spots are limited — register now

name: tell me love: Zine Reading + Creative Walkthrough
description:
tell me love: on lost friendships, grief, and zine-making
~ an intimate reading + creative walkthrough
Friendship breakups are beasts of grief, yet we are rarely given rituals or tools to feel through them. In this session, writer and zine-maker Soumya John shares the creative process behind tell me love, her zine of poems born from old email exchanges with a lost friend.
Through letter-writing, collage, and poetry, this zine transforms nostalgia and grief into beauty and meaning. Part reading, part storytelling, and part art therapy, Soumya invites you to witness how zine-making can be a sacred creative practice of remembrance, tenderness, and healing.
When: September 26, Friday, 6:15 PM
Where: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, Bengaluru

name: Collaborative Zines Workshop | Indie Ink 2025
description:
Zine artist Preston Olakatu will guide participants through the process of making a collaborative zine from scratch. Together, we’ll explore how individual ideas and artistic styles can come together to form a single, cohesive publication.

Expect a mix of brainstorming, quick doodling, collage-making, and storytelling exercises that allow every participant to contribute their unique voice. This workshop is a playful, hands-on way to connect with others, experiment with self-expression, and walk away with a one-of-a-kind collective zine created by the group.

🗓 26 September, Friday, 5:00 PM
📌 Atta Galatta, Indiranagar 

Free, registration mandatory! 

No prior experience is required — just bring your curiosity, creativity, and willingness to collaborate!

name: Panel: Why Zines Matter | Indie Ink 2025
description:
“From Punk to Perzines: Why Zines Matter Today” – a conversation on the role of zines in amplifying voices, building communities, and pushing the boundaries of independent publishing.

Panelists:
Soundarya Gottapu, Zine Artist
Jyotsna Ramesh, Zine Artist

When: September 28, Sunday, 12 PM
Where: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
Free entry! Registration must.

name: Secret Hour
description:
Same secrets from last year, but the desserts are entirely different. We’re bringing back SECRET HOUR! 

This Sunday(21st September) from 9pm-12am, we’ll be serving our favourite desserts with a secret added to it.

name: Be a Neighbourhood Naturalist
description:
Nature isn’t only in forests or national parks - it’s right outside your door. Neighbourhood Naturalist invites you to slow down and notice the birds, butterflies, trees, and little creatures that share your everyday spaces.

Through guided walks, fun games, and simple observation tips, you’ll learn how to spot and identify common species, keep a field journal, and even contribute to citizen science. Perfect for age group above 7, this event is about curiosity, connection, and rediscovering the joy of the outdoors.

Come join us and see your neighbourhood in a whole new light!

name: Soka Sunday Ritualt ft Sando Club
description: Sando Club, Bangalore brings to Soka their mouth watering famous sandos for 1 afternoon. Here's your chance to try their sandos if you've haven't before,  along with some brunch special Soka cocktails.

name: Learn to Crochet
description: Ready to get hooked? Whether you're a complete beginner or looking to level up your skills, our crochet classes are where creativity comes to life — one stitch at a time. Relax, unwind, and connect with others as you turn simple yarn into something truly special. From cozy home decor to personalized gifts, we’ll help you make it with heart. Come for the yarn, stay for the joy. The workshop includes guidance on selecting your yarn and hook, holding a hook, reading patterns independently, mastering basic stitches, stitching pieces together, using safety eyes, and provides all necessary materials like yarn, hook, needle, fibrefill, stitch markers, and more. You'll have the flexibility to make up to two missed classes within one month during the course duration, offered both online and offline. Plus, you'll gain lifetime access to crochet expertise—any queries about the classes are always welcome. Please note, no refunds are available for missed classes that are not redeemed within the stipulated time period, and materials for projects beyond the scope of the sessions are not provided. The classes are held at Arohan Center for Learning in Jayanagar, Bengaluru, and are priced at INR 1600. Spaces fill fast — book your spot today!

location.name: Arohan Center for Learning, Jayanagar
location.address: Arohan Center for Learning, Jayanagar, Bangalore

name: The Battle of Bangalore Walk
description: Join BengaluruPrayana for a captivating historical walk that revisits the dramatic events of the 1791 'Battle of Bangalore.' This early morning tour, beginning at 7:30 AM, transports participants back to the Third Anglo-Mysore War, a defining moment in the city's history. The walk will trace the footsteps of the armies of Tipu Sultan and the British East India Company, led by Lord Cornwallis. As you traverse the area around the historic Bangalore Fort and MG Road, the guide will recount the strategic maneuvers, the siege of the fort, and the eventual capture of the city by the British forces. This narrative-driven experience brings history to life by connecting historical accounts to the physical locations where these events transpired. You will learn about the fortifications of the old city, the key figures involved in the conflict, and the long-term consequences of the battle, which paved the way for British dominance in the region. This tour is ideal for military history enthusiasts, students, and anyone interested in understanding the forces that shaped modern Bengaluru. It offers a profound perspective on how historical conflicts have left an indelible mark on the city's landscape and identity, turning a simple walk into a compelling journey through time.

name: In Her Interest by Zerodha
description: Women have a complicated relationship with money. And it starts early. Many families shield their daughters from anything related to ‘finance’, but this well-meaning protection ends up being a disservice. When these young women step into the real world, they lack the confidence to make financial decisions—not because they’re incapable, but because they were never given information on budgeting, savings, and investments. Later in life, many continue to rely on their partners for investment decisions. This dependency on others will only stop when they have the right information and toolkit to take back control. That’s where we come in. After two 'In Her Interest' pilots, we've realised what women need is a safe, private space to talk money—where no question is too small or too basic. In our 5th In Her Interest session on September 20th in Bangalore, we will focus on two topics: how to create and build passive income and how to save for your retirement. The session is at the Samagata Foundation, on St. Mark's Road, Bangalore. Sushmitha Shetty—a homemaker and trader who makes 60 k as passive income—and Dr. Sagneet Kaur, Financial Behaviour Scientist at PGIM‑Asset Management with a focus on retirement, will lead the session. The key areas we cover are: - The foundations of income - Why passive income matters, especially for women? - Case study of a personal story on how the speaker built and grew passive income - How to start looking for passive income? - How can your hobby make money and drive financial freedom? - How can your social network help you earn? - Starting small, the importance of consistency, and how to scale - How to achieve a happy and fulfilling retirement? - Worksheets to get you started on both topics Session goals: 1. Simplify money concepts 2. Bust common financial myths 3. Build your confidence in making financial decisions No jargon, just real talk. Note: Each session is theme-based. This session is about 'Creating and Building Passive Income and Saving for Retirement'—we are not talking stocks and shares. What's included: Coffee and snacks. What's not: Parking—you can park diagonally across in the Shobha Building.

name: Art with Code
description: This program introduces coding through interactive art, teaching p5.js and JavaScript to facilitate the generation of art based on the 'Ticket Tika Chaap' theme. The workshop is led by facilitator Tanvi Kumar from Paper Crane Lab. Participants are required to bring their own laptops for this hands-on session. It is a beginner-friendly workshop designed for those with little to no prior experience in coding, aiming to demystify the process and show the creative possibilities of technology. The session will guide attendees through the fundamentals of creative coding, starting with basic shapes and colors and progressing to more complex, interactive artworks. The goal is to empower participants to create their own unique digital art pieces inspired by the museum's collections. By the end of the workshop, attendees will have a foundational understanding of JavaScript and the p5.js library, and will have created their own generative art project. This event provides a unique intersection of art and technology, encouraging a new way of thinking about creativity and digital tools in the modern world. The workshop is free to attend, though registration is required to secure a spot in this popular and innovative session.

name: All My Girls by Iris Gusner
description: The Goethe-Institut presents a special screening of 'All My Girls' ('Alle meine Mädchen'), a significant 1980 film from the German Democratic Republic (GDR) directed by the pioneering Iris Gusner. The film offers a fascinating look into the lives of women in East Germany, centering on Ralf, a film student who decides to document the lives of a team of six women working at the NARVA light bulb factory. As he delves into their world, the film explores their ambitions, friendships, and the challenges they face both in the workplace and in their personal lives. 'All My Girls' stands out for its authentic portrayal of female labor and camaraderie within the socialist state, moving beyond simple propaganda to offer a nuanced and humanistic perspective. Running for 86 minutes, this color film will be presented in its original German with English subtitles, providing a rare opportunity for audiences to experience a key work of East German cinema. The screening is part of a curated series that highlights important and often overlooked films from the DEFA studio era. Entry to this event is free, inviting film lovers and those interested in social history to discover the unique cinematic voice of Iris Gusner and gain insight into a bygone era.

location.name: Goethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan, Indirangar
location.address: Goethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan, Indirangar, Bangalore

name: Matcha Brewing Workshop
description: Join us for a refreshing afternoon of matcha mastery at Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters. In collaboration with Got Tea, this immersive Matcha Brewing Workshop will guide you through the art of brewing ceremonial‑grade matcha, exploring matcha styles, pairings, and techniques. Whether you're new to matcha or a long‑time fan, this hands‑on session is designed to deepen your love for this vibrant green tea. What’s included: expert‑led session covering traditional brewing methods (Usucha & Koicha), guided tastings of matcha grades and regional variations, learn to craft three creative modern matcha beverages, printed Matcha Booklet to take home, limited group size for a more focused experience. Date: 20th September 2025 (Saturday) Time: 11 AM – 1 PM Location: Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters at Maker Maxity, Panchsheel, and AECS Layout. Don’t miss this unique celebration of matcha, tea culture, and craftsmanship. Please note that tickets for this event are non‑refundable and cannot be transferred to future events.

name: Chess Cafe
description: Join the Bangalore Chess Club for 'Chess Cafe: A Chess Meetup with a Twist,' a unique and casual gathering designed to blend the intellectual thrill of chess with the relaxed ambiance of a coffee shop. This event is open to everyone, from complete beginners with no prior chess experience to seasoned players looking for a friendly community. The goal is to foster camaraderie and fun over the board. Your ticket not only grants you 2.5 hours of engaging chess play but also includes a food coupon worth ₹200. Participants will have the exciting opportunity to play on the AI-powered GoChess Smart Board, adding a modern touch to the classic game. The meetup will feature a variety of chess formats to keep things interesting, including Casual Standard Chess in a knockout format, the collaborative Hand & Brain Chess team variant, the fast-paced Bughouse (also known as supply chess), a Simultaneous Chess Exhibition where one player takes on multiple opponents at once, and the unconventional Anti Chess, where the objective is to lose all your pieces. Please note that tickets are non-refundable. Attendees are requested to arrive 15 minutes early to settle in. All venue rules must be respected, and by attending, you consent to photography.

name: DIY Fondant Cake
description: Here’s the event description from the webpage exactly as shown—no changes have been made: Fondant Cake Decoration Workshop – Bangalore 🎂✨ Looking for fun things to do in Bangalore? Join our DIY Fondant Cake Decoration Workshop in Whitefield – perfect for kids (5+) and adults! In this hands‑on session, you’ll: 🍰 Decorate a half‑kg cake (choose chocolate or vanilla – cake is pre‑baked) 🎨 Learn fondant techniques – kneading, rolling, covering & shaping 🦄🚀 Make a themed fondant cake topper (Unicorn or Rocketship) 🎉 Take home your decorated cake to enjoy with family & friends No baking skills needed – just bring your creativity! 📅 Date: 20th September 📍 Location: Fired Up Studio, Whitefield, Bangalore 💰 Fee: ₹1999 (includes all materials) Perfect for date nights, girls’ night out, parent‑child activities, weekend plans, birthdays, and anyone looking for a unique craft or culinary workshop in Bangalore. Spots are limited – Book now and make your own edible masterpiece!

name: The Nutritional Code: Unlocking your Genomic Menu
description: How does your DNA shape your health? At Science Gallery Bengaluru, Ashok Gopinath unpacks the science of genomics and its role in nutrition, fitness, and disease prevention. This lecture traces how decoding your genetic code can guide smarter choices in food, exercise, and lifestyle—revealing the future of precision health and its potential to build stronger, healthier communities.

name: Caribbean Sounds
description: A Caribbean-themed night celebrating the Caribbean soundscape including Dancehall, Soca, Zouk and riddim cuts. The event features selectors Reflected Ray, Ritz, and KLY, promoting a carnival-style dance night. Guestlist is live, check the link in bio for registration details. Cover charges will be applicable post-guestlist. The provided information did not contain a full caption to meet the 200-word requirement.

name: Heritage India Tour
description: Get ready for a once-in-a-lifetime musical journey with Dr. Satinder Sartaaj. From powerful high‑energy Bhangra beats that make the audience dance non‑stop, to heartfelt lyrics that touch your soul and bring tears to your eyes, this concert is a perfect blend of joy, emotion, and magic that will stay with you forever.

name: Onam Special featuring Oorali Band
description: Celebrate Onam with the Oorali Band as they bring their high-energy blend of Malayalam folk, theatre, and contemporary sounds to Fandom at Gilly’s Redefined. Known for their immersive performances, Oorali weaves music, dance, and storytelling into a vibrant stage act that captures the festive spirit. Expect an evening of rhythm, celebration, and community as tradition meets bold, modern expression.

location.name: Fandom at Gilly's Redefined, Koramangala
location.address: Fandom at Gilly's Redefined, Koramangala, Bangalore

name: Western Ghats Odyssey
description: WER 2025 – India’s toughest unsupported ultra-cycling race through the majestic Western Ghats of Karnataka, Tamilnadu & Kerala. At Aarohan we strive to bring you the very best – from unexplored trails to challenging terrains and breathtaking landscapes. This year’s edition promises a brand new route, packed with new thrills, tougher climbs, and unforgettable experiences. With just about a month to go, it's time to get ready – and we promise, you won’t be disappointed! Register now for an enchanting Western Ghats Odyssey you can race to test your limits or enjoy bikepacking. Date - 20 Sep @ 6:00 AM. Start & Finish - FKCCI, Bangalore. Distance - 1500 Km. Elevation - 20000 Mtrs. Cut off time - 144 Hrs.

name: Introduction to Belly dance
description: This 2 hr session explains the Fundamentals of Belly danc. The demo session takes you through the origin of this dance form, the nuances, brief history, music, body posture, arm poses & basic movement patterns in terms of body isolations & Shimmies! The session is suitable for beginners to experience the joy of Belly Dancing.!

name: Arangetram 2025 - Exhibition & Sale
description: Come join us on 20th September at Coro Workspace in Domlur from 11am - 7pm for ARANGETRAM 2025, an exhibition and sale showcasing the incredible talent emerging from Clay Station. This year's event features a diverse group of ceramic artists, each presenting a unique and compelling body of work. Meet Shambhavi, who will present her 'Solids and Voids' series. This collection draws deep inspiration from the intricate jali walls and traditional kolam patterns, exploring the interplay of light, shadow, and form in contemporary ceramics. Her work is a testament to the beauty found in architectural heritage, translated into delicate and powerful ceramic pieces. Discover the functional artistry of Ashvin with his 'New Traditions' collection of functional stoneware. Ashvin's work bridges the gap between everyday utility and aesthetic beauty, creating pieces that are meant to be used and cherished. His focus on form and glaze results in timeless stoneware that brings a touch of handcrafted elegance to any home. Experience the innovative work of Archa, who masterfully incorporates traditional screw pine weaving techniques into her ceramic forms. This unique fusion of materials and crafts creates a stunning dialogue between textures and traditions, resulting in pieces that are both visually striking and culturally rich. Explore the thought-provoking collection by Noor, titled 'The Silent Rulebook.' Through her ceramic art, Noor delves into the unspoken rules and societal expectations that shape the lives of women, creating powerful narratives that challenge and inspire. Be captivated by Ronita's sea-themed creations, which evoke the mystery and majesty of the ocean. Her work captures the fluid movement and organic forms of marine life, rendered in beautiful, expressive ceramic. The exhibition also features collections from talented artists like Sonu, Archana, and Srinidhi. Don't miss this opportunity to witness the culmination of their artistic journeys and acquire a unique piece of ceramic art.

name: Run, Mocktails & Pool Rave
description: Celebrate the culmination of World Wellness Weekend with an exclusive Pool Rave at the luxurious Shangri-La hotel. Kicking off at 6:00 PM, this evening event promises a unique fusion of high-energy fun and rejuvenating vibes. As the sun sets over the city, the hotel's stunning poolside will transform into a vibrant party scene, likely featuring a live DJ spinning upbeat tracks to create an electrifying atmosphere. This event is designed to be more than just a party; it's a celebration of well-being. Guests can expect an environment that balances excitement with relaxation. Imagine dancing by the shimmering water, socializing in a chic and sophisticated setting, and enjoying curated beverages and bites. The 'World Wellness Weekend' theme suggests that there may be elements focused on health and mindfulness, perhaps through healthy drink options, designated chill-out zones, or other thoughtful touches. This event offers the perfect opportunity to unwind, de-stress, and connect with others in a glamorous setting. It's an ideal way to cap off the week, blending the thrill of a rave with the serene ambiance of a luxury resort, creating a memorable and holistic nightlife experience for all attendees.

name: Calligraphy Workshop 101
description: Want to explore a beautiful and relaxing new hobby? Join our beginner‑friendly calligraphy workshop! In this hands‑on session, you’ll learn the essential strokes and techniques to create elegant letterforms and discover the foundations of this timeless art. Our experienced instructor, who has seven years of experience in the field, will guide you every step of the way. We’ll provide all the tools and materials you’ll need, including pens, paper, and ink, so you don’t need to bring a thing. The registration fee also includes a selection of delicious food and refreshing beverages to keep you fueled throughout the session. Come learn, create, and unwind with us!

name: Piano Portraits
description: The Bangalore School of Music presents Piano Portraits: Reflections, an evening of solos, duets, ensemble pieces, and singing by the pupils of S.B. Ebenezer Manoraj. Hosted at the Aruna Sunderlal Auditorium, this free concert highlights young talent in a showcase of classical piano and collaborative performance, offering audiences a rich and intimate musical experience.

location.name: The Bangalore School of Music
location.address: The Bangalore School of Music, Bangalore

name: The Seiko Exhibition
description: Step into horological history this weekend at Fanpark, Mall of Asia—where Seiko’s legendary Diver’s watch and Japan’s first iconic Seiko models go on display for the first time in Bengaluru. A rare chance to see timekeeping milestones up close, from 19th to 21st September. ⏱️🇯🇵

location.name: Fan Park Mall of Asia, Sahakar Nagar
location.address: Fan Park Mall of Asia, Sahakar Nagar, Bangalore

name: Chai & Croissant: Intercultural Relationships Workshop
description: Chai & Croissant returns at Alliance Française de Bangalore with a playful afternoon exploring the realities of intercultural love—beyond Bollywood romance and into the messy, beautiful truth of relationships across borders. Alongside the conversation, enjoy an authentic French croissant with your chai. 🥐☕

name: Cake Painting Workshop
description: Join this unique Cake Painting Workshop at Eywa Café. Learn how to turn your cake into a beautiful canvas using edible buttercream paints. Whether you’re a beginner or a baking enthusiast, this hands-on session promises fun, flavour, and artistry, with a cake you can proudly take home

name: Mushroom Yoga Brunch | Nuvedo x Maverick & Farmer
description:
The Mushroom Brunch is a collaborative weekend experience that blends yoga, food, coffee, and fungi culture. Designed as an intimate gathering, it celebrates mushrooms not only as nourishment but as a bridge between wellness, flavor, and community.

🍄 The Concept

This brunch brings together four collaborators—Nuvedo, Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Chef Sejal, and Lisha Sinha, to create a flow where participants can move, learn, taste, and connect. From yoga to mushroom harvesting, live cooking to coffee and conversation, the event is about exploring how mushrooms enrich our lives in unexpected ways.

✨ Facilitators

Nuvedo – India’s functional mushroom brand, cultivating trust, transparency, and fungi-based wellness. Learn more: www.nuvedo.com
Maverick & Farmer – One of India’s few true farm-to-cup coffee brands. With a 140-acre estate in Coorg and a roastery in Bangalore, they produce experimental, award-winning single-estate coffees shipped across India and abroad. Their team, with over a decade of roasting experience, helped pioneer India’s fourth wave of coffee. Learn more: https://www.maverickandfarmer.com/ 
Chef Sejal Agrawal – A vegan, plant-based chef trained at The Vegan School, Goa. Currently a chef at C+C, she also takes on private chef projects, crafting nourishing meals that often give classic non-vegan dishes a vibrant, plant-based twist. Her passion lies in Asian flavors, food R&D, and showing how fun and delicious plant-based eating can be. https://www.instagram.com/chef.sejal/ 
Lisha Sinha – A yoga teacher with over 500 hours of training in Ashtanga, Vinyasa, and Hatha yoga. Lisha integrates breathwork, meditation, and sound in her sessions, inspired by teachers like B.K.S. Iyengar and Sharath Jois. She believes yoga is about presence and resilience, and through her platform Wellness Loop, she creates mindful wellness experiences for individuals and corporates . https://www.instagram.com/lishasinha/ 


📌 Where: Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Gate #3, Gangadhar Chetty Rd, Halasuru, Rukmani Colony, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042 ( https://maps.app.goo.gl/fkCEsqACpZJ3TMEo9 )

📆 Date: September 28th, 2025
⌚ Time: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM
💰 Cost: INR 1800 + GST (includes all activities and refreshments)
LIMITED SEATS AVAILABLE — Book now to secure your spot!

🔗 REGISTER HERE: https://rzp.io/rzp/Z5kmeRUj

Nuvedo x Maverick & Farmer Coffee with Chef Sejal & Lisha Sinha

name: Soju & Slurp
description:
If you've been waiting to try Korean food in a homely setting, this is your chance! 

Hi, I'm Simran and I run koreatindia (A veg korean supper club). At Soju & Slurp, expect a cozy space where you can chill on a Sunday afternoon, make conversations with new people, relax with soju cocktails and eat to your heart's content. We have a fully curated veg Korean menu that will promise to leave your taste buds tingling for more 💕

name: The Bohra Bohra Thaal Supper Club
description:
Street Food Feast Awaits! 🍽️🔥 Dive into the flavors of authentic Mumbai and Bohri delights at The Bohra Bohra Thaal Supper Club! 🤩 Bohri Chicken Farcha, Mutton Raan and  Dum Biryani, Parsi-style Caramel Custard, & more – every bite a burst of tradition and taste! 🍗
Come hungry, wear comfy clothes, and get ready for an unforgettable evening of food, fun, and farmaishi!
Book your spot now and make this supper club experience one to savor!  

Can’t wait to host you!
📅date and 🕰 Time : 
 Sept 21st : 12pm brunch 

Price per seat  : 2900(includes gst )
📍 Jpnagar, Bangalore   
📞 +91 9742661909

name: Folding Ninjas with Roligami
description:
Not every gathering needs to be a formal workshop! Casual Fold & Connect Nights are all about relaxed creativity, sharing, and building community through Origami. Whether you’re seeking a new hobby, a meditative practice, or a creative outlet, the Folding Ninjas welcomes you! No prior experience is necessary—just bring your curiosity and enthusiasm.

For All Skill Levels:
Absolute Beginners: Get started with some easy folds!
Intermediate Folders: Refine techniques, learn, and seek help from fellow folders.
Advanced Practitioners: Experiment, teach others, and push creative boundaries.

Meet-Up Structure
-Welcome and Warm-Up (30 minutes)
-Check-in and settle in.
-Ice-breaker activity: A quick origami-related game or fold to get everyone engaged.
-Skill level check-in: Beginners are paired with experienced folders for personalised guidance.

Free-Form Folding (60 minutes)
-No structured instructions, but beginners will receive guidance.
-Bring your own projects or start something new.
-Collaborative and spontaneous folding.
-Free exchange of techniques and ideas.

Show and Share (30 minutes)
-Members showcase their completed projects.
-Constructive feedback and celebration of individual achievements.
-Informal networking and social time.

What to Bring
Beginners: Nothing! All materials are provided.

Experienced Folders:
-Your own specialty papers (optional).
-Any unique tools or templates you’d like to share.
-Completed projects for show and tell.
-Snacks to share (optional).
-Materials Provided
-Variety of origami papers.
-Instructional guides.
-Basic tools (rulers, pencils, paper cutters, glue).

Who is Roligami?

Roli Agrawal, fondly known as Roligami, is a multi-disciplinary designer and passionate craft enthusiast. Inspired by her love for Japanese culture, she has been exploring and teaching origami for over a decade. Her workshops are a celebration of creativity, and her delightful creations highlight the beauty of paper folding.

Embrace the joy of folding and creativity in a warm, welcoming environment!
